intro: Loxocarpus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline, exhibiting salt tolerance and resilience to maritime conditions. Its small white to pale blue flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often used in coastal landscaping for its hardiness and ornamental value.
